Dogecoin jumped 3% in the minutes that followed Musk’s apology, jumping from 19 cents to above 20 cents . The currency has pulled back slightly since the post but remains up 2% . The price rebound comes after Musk and Trump entered into a public feud on social media .  The two men continued to exchange barbs on Twitter on June 5 . Trump responded to Musk’s claims that Trump “is in the Epstein files,” in another since-deleted post on X.org .  Musk-related news has a history ofinfluencing the price of Dogecoin, the crypto industry’s first and most popular memecoin . Trump has previously denied any wrongdoing in relation to Epstein .  It has rebounded since then, but still remains below its previous price . This story was originally featured onFortune.com.com .

Elon Musk issued strongest sign of contrition yet over his handling of the dramatic break with Donald Trump . Vice President JD Vance and White House chief of staff called Musk last Friday to urge him to end his conflict with Trump . Musk served as a close adviser and confidant to Trump until a bitter public falling-out last week .  The dispute was triggered by Musk’s opposition to the tax-cut bill Trump is pushing through Congress . “They went too far. week,” Musk posted Wednesday on his social-media platform, X. week . Musk called the president before his public expression of regret, New York Times reported .  Musk was first to stand down from what had been an escalating spat, responding to advice from those online to de-escalate . Musk had riled Trump by claiming credit for his election victory, endorsing his impeachment and even suggesting the president was implicated in the sex crimes of Jeffrey Epstein .  Musk led the so-called Department of Government Efficiency, which sought to slash spending, shutter agencies and cut the federal workforce . The department aimed to generate $1 trillion of savings but fell far short of that goal, producing just $180 billion by its own unverified accounting . Musk was a nearly ubiquitous presence in the White House during the first several months of Trump's second term .  New Grads join worst entry-level job market in years . Tesla aims to launch self-driving 'robotaxis' in its home base of Austin, Texas . Public-safety officials are increasingly concerned about the state’s anti-regulation stance toward autonomous vehicles . The launch of between 10 and 20 Model Y vehicles follows a decade of unfulfilled promises from CEO Elon Musk .  The Texas legislature in 2017 prohibited cities from regulating autonomous vehicles . Now, as the vehicles proliferate, some politicians, public-safety officials and advocates are pushing for more rules . Austin police officers continually have run into problems with autonomous vehicles freezing up .  The Texas legislature passed a bill last month that would require autonomous-vehicle companies to apply for authorization to operate in the state . It is unclear when the new system would take effect, but likely not until next year, a state Department of Motor Vehicles spokesperson said .  In January, Musk said Tesla would be offering autonomous ride-hailing for money in Austin . In April, he said the Austin rollout would begin with 10 or 20 Model Y vehicles . He predicted there would be “millions of Teslas” operating “fully autonomously” by the end of next year .  Elon Musk says public rides will begin "tentatively, June 22," adding "the date could shift" Musk and Tesla have not said who the passengers will be, how Tesla will charge for rides, where they will operate .  Tesla advertisements for “teleoperation’ positions say the company needs the ability to “access and control” autonomous vehicles and humanoid robots remotely . The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration inquired last month about many of the unanswered questions surrounding the Austin rollout . The agency is investigating Tesla's driver-assistance feature after a fatal crash in 2023 .  The Texas attorney general is considering a Reuters request for communications between Tesla and city officials in Austin over the past two years . Tesla has opposed the request over trade secrets concerns . Safety experts say there has been a dearth of information about Tesla's technology .  Cars on the road and not having a crash is “table stakes for this game.” Koopman said . “Car accidents are sort of table stakes for the game,” he said .

Investors are looking for a win that can help repair the brand damage and shift Tesla back into growth mode . Musk said Tesla would start the new self-driving car service in Austin as soon as June 22 .  Tesla CEO Elon Musk says the service's debut could shift because it's "super paranoid about safety" The proclamation came as part of an all-night series of social media messages by Musk . Investors have been urging Musk to refocus on his business empire .  The government has outsized influence over Musk's businesses . Musk has promised to establish a ride-hailing network that is part “Airbnb, part Uber’s”  Tesla will be the fourth robotaxi service to launch in Austin in the past several years . Musk predicts hundreds of thousands of the vehicles will be on the road by late 2026 .  The initial operation area will likely cover only a few square miles, a source says . The rules governing driverless vehicles in Texas are notably light . Texas is popular choice for companies in early stages of autonomous service .  Tesla has embraced a different approach to autonomy, favoring a camera-only system rather than a combination of lidar, radar and pre-mapping that competitors use . Musk has long claimed such an approach will allow the company to scale up sooner than rivals including Waymo, which he considers too expensive .  Tesla has been in touch with Austin city officials and first responders to discuss safety expectations . The company has said robotaxis will be remotely monitored initially . Last week, Waymo drove into a flooded area following a storm .  Elon Musk's public spat with President Trump threatens to alienate even more customers . It’s also a complicated moment for Musk to pitch Tesla as a trusted brand to take passengers where they need to go .  Driverless vehicles require an extra element of trust and critics will be ready to amplify any mishaps . Baird analyst Ben Kallo downgraded Tesla to neutral citing overhyped expectations from Musk .  Kallo: “Rolling this out will be very difficult. At first it will require more people, so people in control centers making sure that the cars do not get into accidents something like that. take longer.” For that reason, Kallo said there will likely be some short-term pain.

Some investors are questioning the amount of cash Big Tech is throwing at artificial intelligence . Concerns fuel concerns for profit margins and the risk that depreciation expenses will drag stocks down . “On a cash flow basis they’ve all stagnated," says Jim Morrow, founder and chief executive officer at Callodine Capital Management .  Amazon, Microsoft, Meta Platforms and Microsoft projected to spend $311 billion on capital expenses in fiscal years and $337 billion in 2026 . That includes a more than 60% increase during the first quarter from the same period a year ago .  Since April 8, the biggest AI exchange-traded fund, the Global X Artificial Intelligence & Technology ETF, is up 34%, while AI chipmaker Nvidia Corp. has soared 49% . Investors still have a hearty appetite for technology giants given their dominant market positions .  Meta leader Mark Zuckerberg is recruiting a secretive AI brain trust of researchers and engineers to help the company achieve “artificial general intelligence” The drag on the bottom line will put increased pressure on the companies to show bigger returns on investments .  Earlier this year, Meta Platforms extended the useful life period of certain servers and networking assets to five and a half years . The change resulted in a roughly $695 million increase in net income, or 27 cents a share, in the first quarter . Other companies are taking similar steps .  The big risk is what happens if AI investments don't lead to a dramatic growth in revenue and profitability . That kind of market shock occurred in 2022, when a contraction in profits and rising interest rates sent technology stocks plummeting . Amazon, however, has taken the opposite approach . The video shows a Model Y, clearly labeled "Robotaxi," navigating an intersection on its own with no driver in sight . The company sees robotaxis as a potential game-changing revenue stream as competition heats up in the core EV market .  Waymo is currently running commercial robotaxi services in four U.S. cities . Baidu is now preparing to expand its Apollo Go service into Europe, starting with Switzerland by the end of 2025 . The company is also planning a launch in Turkey, further widening its global footprint . Tesla's long-promised robotaxi service could go live June 22 in Austin, Texas . CEO Elon Musk teased a tentative launch date after sharing a clip of a Model Y cruising driverless through city streets . The pilot is Tesla's boldest push yet to pivot from selling cars to renting rides .  A smooth Austin rollout would validate Tesla's self-driving tech, shift Wall Street's focus from slumping EV margins to lucrative ride-hailing fees . Musk has long claimed that autonomous mobility is the key to a future $30 trillion valuation .

TheTeslaCEO said public rides are “tentatively” planned to begin on June 22 . Farzad Mesbahi jumped into his Cybertruck and sped downtown, hunting for a glimpse of a driverless Model Y Juniper .  Tesla CEO livestreamed his search for the elusive black crossover with the word “Robotaxi” on the door . The widely-shared nine-second clip already has over 15 million views on Musk’s ownXplatform . The first Tesla that drives itself from the factory to a customer's house would be June 28 .  Tesla has claimed it was on the cusp of solving unsupervised full self-driving, or FSD, for years . The company has undergone two full hardware upgrades to its AI inference computer, now in its fourth generation .  Unlike competitors, Tesla doesn’t rely on multiple, expensive lidars and a host of radars . Instead it relies solely on artificial intelligence to make sense of the two-dimensional images provided by its comparatively affordable cameras as eyes . Critics have long argued this is a high-risk gamble, however, since there’s no guarantee regulators would green-light robotaxis that are autonomous .  Tesla could push out its latest version of the software overnight to the hundreds of thousands of cars already on U.S. roads, so long as they are equipped with its fourth-gen AI inference computer commonly known as HW4 . That's because of a prescient decision made many years ago by the CEO to buck the usual industry practice of only equipping hardware a customer orders on purchase .  Musk has called this Tesla’s “ChatGPT moment” The Model Y robotaxi pictured in the clip was standard-issue and did not feature any concealed hardware . “These are unmodified Tesla cars coming straight from the factory,” Musk said .

Elon Musk says he regrets some of his recent social media posts about President Donald Trump . Musk’s relationship with Trump deteriorated last week as the two men traded jibes on social media platforms .  Musk tweeted that Trump would have lost last year’s presidential election without him . Trump said last week that he could terminate government contracts and subsidies awarded to Musk's X companies . Musk did not provide any evidence to back up his claim that Trump's name is included in unreleased records relating to Epstein .  The president said he held “no hard feelings” against Musk, adding that he “was really surprised” the billionaire had criticized his tax cut bill . In recent days, Musk softened his tone toward Trump, deleting some of his most inflammatory X posts .  Musk did not specify which of his previous comments about Trump he regretted posting . He has long supported closed borders, deportations and stopping illegal immigration, in alignment with the Trump administration . His father, who has a strained relationship with his son, said he believes the two will eventually reconcile .

Tesla has become the poster child for the autonomous driving revolution on Wall Street . Uber is approaching autonomous vehicles with a unique strategy that could pay off significantly in the long run .  The Cybercab is a true autonomous vehicle that doesn't come with pedals or even a steering wheel . It runs entirely on Tesla's FSD software, which has been available in beta mode for the last few years . Tesla has been releasing safety data for the beta versions of FSD since 2018 .  Unsupervised FSD could reduce car accidents by 90% across the country if everybody uses the software . Tesla is confident it will be approved for unsupervised use sometime this year . The Cybercab will be able to haul passengers and even complete commercial deliveries around the clock .  More than 170 million people use Uber every month, so it has a huge advantage over Tesla . At the end of the first quarter of 2025, Uber had 18 partnerships with developers of autonomous technologies . One of those partners is Waymo, which is already completing 250,000 paid autonomous ride-hailing trips every week .  During the first quarter, Uber generated $42.8 billion in gross bookings . The company was left with $11.5 billion in revenue for the quarter . After deducting operating costs like marketing, Uber made $1.7 billion in profit on a GAAP basis .  Uber could theoretically partner with an infinite number of developers of self-driving vehicles to automate its entire network without committing practically any capital investment itself . Tesla doesn't have that luxury since it will have to spend an enormous amount of money to manufacture Cybercabs, continue improving its software, build a network, and then achieve scale .  Tesla stock trades at an exorbitant valuation right now, which creates a significant downside risk . Uber is in a better position to build a successful autonomous ride-hailing business over the long term . Tesla could be years away from generating meaningful revenue . Elon Musk has abruptly walked back his attacks on President Donald Trump . Musk has called for his impeachment and denounced a key spending bill . The Space X founder has deleted some of his most incendiary posts .  For Musk, such a public apology directed at a prominent political figure is almost unheard of . Musk has previously told former Canadian prime minister Justin Trudeau that it “doesn’t matter what you say” President Trump has extracted a 180-degree turn from Musk .  Musk has been feuding with Peter Navarro, a top Trump advisor . Navarro was appointed to lead the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), which would supposedly axe $2 trillion from federal spending . Musk also reportedly advised the White House against tariffs .  Tesla CEO called for President Trump to be impeached after leaving D.C. as a special government employee . Musk called for a 'zero tariff' trade zone between the U.S. and Europe . Tesla CEO also called for the White House to cancel the 'Big, Beautiful Bill'  Trump has warned that Musk’s federal contract could be due for a review . However, the president added recently he “wasn’t thinking” about the Tesla CEO and hopes he does well with his EV-making company .  Musk deleted his posts about Trump and Epstein after the apology . Musk alsoshared positive reaction to the White House’s response to the L.A. protests .

Tesla's electric vehicle (EV) business is struggling, and the company is likely to report poor financial results in the coming quarters . Several analysts have revised their earnings forecasts lower to account for market-share losses and the probable impact of tariffs . Elon Musk said Wednesday that he regretted some social media posts he made last week during a public dispute with U.S. President Donald Trump . Tesla shares rose 1.7% in pre-market trading following Musk’s latest post . Analysts see this as a smart move, with Robotaxi launch on the deck, now anticipated to be June 22 .  The fallout began after the billionaire CEO openly criticized the President’s tax and spending bill . Trump expressed disappointment in Musk's conduct last week . Musk replied on X with several posts, claiming Trump owed his election win to Musk's support . Trump later softened his tone, suggesting he wouldn’t mind if Musk reached out . Elon Musk backed off digs he took at President Donald Trump after extensive outreach from administration officials, including Vice President JD Vance . Musk and SpaceX CEO voiced regret after having launched an exchange of increasingly personal attacks last week on their respective social media sites .  Vance, White House Chief of Staff Susie Wiles and David Sacks pushed for Musk and Trump to make up, sources say . Vance: Trump was "rightfully very frustrated" with about Musk's comments, but had no desire to be in a long-term feud with the billionaire and big campaign donor .  A Tesla investor and adviser to Musk's government cost-cutting effort, James Fishback, posted on X that Musk owed Trump "a full-throated apology" Musk responded: "What's the apology for exactly?" A senior Trump adviser called Fishback to thank him, according to a White House source .  Tesla shares are down 19% on the year, equal to roughly $300 billion in market value . Sales of Tesla have fallen across key markets in Europe, China and U.S. states . Musk is betting big on driverless technology to grow the company .  Musk took credit for Republicans retaining a majority of seats in the House of Representatives and retaking a majority in the Senate with his cash infusion last year . Trump named him to head an effort to downsize the federal workforce and slash spending last month . Trump said he had no intention of repairing ties with Musk .  Musk took the stage in the U.S. with a speech at the end of the day . Musk is the CEO of the electric car company, Tesla Inc .

Tesla’s annualized revenue growth of 5.5% over the last two years was well below its five-year trend . Long-term growth reigns supreme in fundamentals, but for disruptive companies like Tesla, a stretched historical view may miss emerging trends in autonomous vehicles and energy .  Tesla’s free cash flow margin for the trailing 12 months was 7.1% . The company's ROIC, or return on invested capital, shows how much operating profit it makes compared to the money it has raised (debt and equity) Tesla's margin dropped by 4 percentage points over the last five years .  Tesla isn't a terrible business, but it doesn't pass our bar . After the recent drawdown, the stock trades at 124.9× forward price-to-earnings (or $325.10 per share) This multiple tells us a lot of good news is priced in - we think there are better opportunities elsewhere .  Qualitystocks that have generated a market-beating return of 183% over the last five years (as of March 31st 2025) Stocks that made our list in 2020 include now familiar names such as Nvidia (+1,545% between March 2020 and March 2025) as well as under-the-radar businesses like Exlservice (+354% five-year return)

Elon Musk accused Trump of having ties to notorious criminal Jeffrey Epstein . Musk also alleged that without his help, the Republican president would not have won last year’s election . Musk had previously announced plans to cease his political spending .  Tesla CEO Elon Musk's behavior has sparked a global backlash against the brand, causing sales to fall across the U.S. and Europe . When a prominent company starts showing signs of weakness or instability, short sellers are likely to start closing in .  Short sellers pocketed up to $4 billion, noting: Betting against an industry-leading company like Tesla carries some risk . But experts see a case for shorting TSLA stock, provided investors understand its volatile nature, which includes surging unexpectedly .  Stanzione says Tesla's P/E ratio is over 100 and growth the last few years has been near zero . He also raises a concern regarding Tesla's foray into robotics, something on which Musk has hinged a lot of the company’s prospects . “Unless robotaxis start showing up en masse by the end of this year, then investors will keep selling,” he says .  Tesla short sellers may see their edge in the long-term mismatch between its $1 trillion valuation and the reality of its business . Daytrading.com Chief Analyst Dan Buckley also highlights the potential valuation problem . He names rivals such as Hyundai Motor Group and Boston Dynamics, both of which are making notable advances in the robotics field that could threaten Tesla’s progress .  This story was originally reported by TheStreet on Jun 10, 2025, where it first appeared . It was first reported by the Street on June 10, 25, when it was published .

Elon Musk says Tesla is "tentatively" set to begin providing robotaxi service in Austin, Texas, on June 22 . Musk said the date could change because Tesla is “being super paranoid about safety” Musk has been promising fully autonomous, self-driving vehicles “next year” for a decade .  The Austin rollout comes after Musk had a public blowup with President Donald Trump over the administration’s tax bill . Some analysts have expressed concern that Trump could retaliate by encouraging federal safety regulators to to step in at any sign of trouble for the robotaxis .

Tesla stock suffered its largest one-day market capitalization decline with a $152 billion drop after Musk's feud with President Donald Trump . The drop continues a highly volatile year for Tesla stock, with rises and falls related to Musk's push into politics and Trump's 2024 election win .  A recent Wall Street Journal report suggested Tesla's board had discussed the possibility of moving on from Musk . A near majority of Benzinga readers aren't ready to see Tesla's Board of Directors move on from Elon Musk .  Musk indicated that his time in the White House is over, and he will be spending significant time helping to shape Tesla’s future . The board may be unwilling to get rid of the person who has meant so much to the company, even with recent controversy and high share price volatility .  The study was conducted by Benzinga from June 5, 2025, through June 9, 2025 . Opting into the survey was completely voluntary, with no incentives offered to potential respondents . The study reflects results from 212 adults .

Elon Musk and President Donald Trumptook the world by storm last week and sent shares of the electric vehicle company lower . Benzinga recently asked readers who they side with in the battle .  A poll found that a near majority said they would publicly support neither Trump or Musk in the feud between former friends . Musk received the largest support with 25% of the poll, ranking ahead of Trump at 17% .  Tesla stock trades up 1.61% at $299.72 at publication on Monday versus a 52-week trading range of $167.42 to $488.54 . The study was conducted by Benzinga from June 5, 2025, through June 9, 2025 . Tesla plans to begin offering rides on its self-driving robotaxis to the public on June 22, CEO Elon Musk said . Musk has staked his company's future on self-driven vehicles . Commercializing autonomous vehicles has been challenging with safety concerns, tight regulations and tight regulations .  Tesla has been testing its self-driving vehicles on public streets in Austin, Musk said last month . Musk has promised a paid robotaxi service in Austin starting with about 10-20 of its Model Y SUVs . The company plans to expand operations to other U.S. states later in the year .  Little else is known about Tesla's robotaxi service, including where it will operate, the extent of remote supervision and how the public can use the service . The service is using a new version of Tesla's advanced driver assistance software .

Tesla plans to begin offering rides on its self-driving robotaxis to the public on June 22 . CEO Elon Musk has staked his company's future on autonomous vehicles . Commercializing autonomous vehicles has been challenging with safety concerns, tight regulations and tight regulations .  Elon Musk re-posted a video on X that showed a Model Y making a turn at an Austin intersection with no human driver and the word "Robotaxi" written on it . The company plans to expand operations to other U.S. states later in the year .  Tesla is using a new version of its advanced driver assistance software called Full Self-Driving . Tesla shares rose on Tuesday in anticipation of the launch of the EV maker's robotaxi service in Austin, Texas, later this week . The company expects to operate 10 to 20 vehicles starting this week, and grow the fleet in the coming months .  Tesla has set aggressive targets for its AV business . CEO Elon Musk expects to have “hundreds of thousands” of AVs on the road by the end of next year . Goldman Sachs expects operating costs at scale to be about 40 cents per mile .  Goldman expects Tesla to have about 2,500 robotaxis in service by the end of 2027 . The company began production of its Dojo Supercomputer in 2023, and beganprioritizing its robotaxi service in 2024 .  The stock lost more than half of its value between hitting anall-time high in December and early April when stocks nosedived after Trump unveiled steep tariffs on most of the world’s goods . Shares rebounded in late April and May after Musk promised to spend less time in Washington .  The Federal Government will continue to support the growth of these services . Bottom line: "We expect cooler heads to prevail," says Investopedia .

ARK Invest's CEO, Cathie Wood, conservatively estimates that Tesla's (TSLA) stock will reach $2,600 per share by 2030 . Wood's prediction is primarily tied to the forthcoming robotaxi platform, on a podcast called The Diary of a CEO . Wood argues that the major source of revenue for Tesla will now come from its autonomous vehicles .  Tesla could generate even more revenue by incorporating blockchain technology and utilizing cryptocurrency for ride payments or subscriptions . Wood sees Tesla and its customers having the potential to generate revenue in two ways: subscription or pay-as-you-go models . If blockchain is incorporated, crypto could exist with both payment structures .  Cathie Wood's ARK Invest has made big crypto predictions in the past . She predicts Bitcoin will be worth $1.5 million by 2030 and supports a base case of $700,000 . Wood's company also invested $373 million in Circle Circle's initial public offering .
